variable.name: OBTAIN_DVIPA
variable.label: OBTAIN_DVIPA
variable.description: Choice to indicate whether or not to obtain DVIPA resource

variable.name: OBTAIN_PORT
variable.label: OBTAIN_PORT
variable.description: Choice to indicate whether or not to obtain port resource

variable.name: OBTAIN_APPLID
variable.label: OBTAIN_APPLID
variable.description: Choice to indicate whether or not to obtain APPLID resource

variable.name: IP_ADDRESS
variable.label: IP_ADDRESS
variable.description: TCP/IP DVIPA IP Address that will be obtained from the IP pool defined in the z/OSMF Network Configuration Assistant

variable.name: IP_ADDRESS_ID
variable.label: IP_ADDRESS_ID
variable.abstract: Object ID of the IP address
variable.description: The object id of the allocated IP address to use during deprovisioning

variable.name: PORT
variable.label: PORT
variable.description: TCP/IP port number that will be obtained from the port pool defined in the z/OSMF Network Configuration Assistant

variable.name: PORT_ID
variable.label: PORT_ID
variable.abstract: Object ID of the port address
variable.description: The object id of the reserved Port address to use during deprovisioning

variable.name: APPLID
variable.label: APPLID
variable.description: VTAM application ID (APPLID) Name that will be obtained from the APPLID pool defined in the z/OSMF Network Configuration Assistant

variable.name: APPLID_ID
variable.label: APPLID_ID
variable.abstract: Object ID of the APPLID name
variable.description: The object ID of the reserved APPLID name to use during deprovisioning

variable.name: JOB_NAME
variable.label: JOB_NAME
variable.abstract: Job name of server of application that will use allocated port. Specify * if Jobname is not known
variable.description: Identifies z/OS job that will be utilizing the allocated port. This property is required when TCP/IP port is requested. If job name is not known, "*" can be specified as value.

variable.name: USAGE_TYPE
variable.label: USAGE_TYPE
variable.abstract: Usage type that matches with usage type associated with port pool
variable.description: Optional property that identifies type of application (e.g. WLP, CICS or Node) for which port needs to be provisioned. When pool of port ranges defined in z/OSMF Network Configuration Assistant, network administrator can identify usage type for specific port ranges. USAGE_TYPE property must match with usage type defined in z/OSMF Network Configuration Assistant otherwise the port provisioning request will fail. When USAGE_TYPE property is not specified, port is provisioned from a port ranges pool that is defined with out usage type

step.name: allocateNetworkResources
step.title: Allocate Network Resources
step.description: Allocate port and/or DVIPA and/or VTAM APPLID

step.name: allocatePort
step.title: Allocate Port
step.description: Make a REST call to allocate port

condition.description: Check that previous step has completed

targetStateSet.description: Set state to Skipped if TCP/IP port resource is not requested

extendStateExpression.description: Skip if OBTAIN_PORT does not equal YES

step.instructions: Execute step to allocate a port using z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: allocateDVIPA
step.title: Allocate DVIPA

condition.description: Check that previous step has completed

targetStateSet.description: Set state to Skipped if TCP/IP DVIPA resource is not requested

extendStateExpression.description: Skip if OBTAIN_DVIPA does not equal YES

step.instructions: Execute step to obtain the IP address using z/OS Communications Server.

step.name: allocateAPPLID
step.title: Allocate VTAM APPLID

condition.description: Check that previous step has completed

targetStateSet.description: Set state to Skipped if VTAM APPLID_ID resource is not requested

extendStateExpression.description: Skip if OBTAIN_APPLID does not equal YES

step.instructions: Execute step to obtain VTAM APPLID using z/OS Communications Server.
